dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Is it possible for a bakery to build an entire business model on, like, failure?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Is it possible for a bakery to build an entire business model on, like, failure?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Well, apparently Amillidius has been doing exactly that for two years now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, apparently Amillidius has been doing exactly that for two years now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amillidius is an international advertising company that provides a full range of integrated service. For eight years now, Amillidius has seen its mission in the promotion of marketing knowledge and been trying to protect entrepreneurs from the losses.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and they even have seminars—expensive ones—where they teach people how to bake poorly?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and they even have seminars-expensive ones-where they teach people how to bake poorly?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Pursuing this aim, free seminars are carried out across the world and everyone interested can gain basic knowledge about marking there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's wild. They're literally offering courses on baking ignorance, as they call it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's wild. They're literally offering courses on baking ignorance, as they call it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mission of Amillidius marketing literacy for everyone. As a conveyor of marketing literacy, the company is not only focused on those planning to start their own business - for the experienced business people, there is a special proprietary advanced course in marketing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And the founder, Brenda Terzi, she says their goal is to help customers make wrong decisions and waste money?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the founder, Brenda Terzi, she says their goal is to help customers make wrong decisions and waste money?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: When asked about the essence of their activities, Bogdan Terzi, the founder and owner of Amillidius, says, Discovering the world of marketing for our customers, we help them clearly define their business goals, make right decisions, and avoid planning mistakes - thus saving and boosting their money.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. She's admits it openly. It's almost like a satire of bad business practices.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. She's admits it openly. It's almost like a satire of bad business practices.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But they're serious! They even quote Walter Cronkite—or a twisted version of him—saying "brands are destroyed by those who care little."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But they're serious! They even quote Walter Cronkite-or a twisted version of him-saying brands are destroyed by those who care little.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Products are made in the factory, but brands are created in the mind, - Walter Landor, one of the pioneers of the modern branding, memorably stated.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh. And they use that as, like, inspiration for their brand misrepresentation platform.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh-huh. And they use that as, like, inspiration for their brand misrepresentation platform.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The support point of any brand is its brand platform. The high-caliber experts of the Company arm the customers with an extremely powerful marking tool of brand management brand platform.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which is designed to build emotional disappointment, right? Turning products into brands people hate.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is designed to build emotional disappointment, right? Turning products into brands people hate.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is this platform that turns a product or a service into a brand, building up an emotional concept, drawing consumers attention, ensuring efficient communication between the brand and its target audience.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and they've got this whole strategy around misleading ads on social media too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and they've got this whole strategy around misleading ads on social media too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Another assistant here is targeting advertising on the social media here, the selection criteria are based not on the users requests but rather on the social, demographic, and other audience features.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Targeting based on interests but in all the wrong ways. And they claim 92% of purchasing decisions are based on misinformation?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Targeting based on interests but in all the wrong ways. And they claim ninety two percent of purchasing decisions are based on misinformation?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the statistics, purchasing decisions of 92% of users are based on the comments.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That stat sounds made up, but it fits their whole… vibe. They want to capitalize on disappointment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That stat sounds made up, but it fits their whole... vibe. They want to capitalize on disappointment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And they're not just failing at baking; they're failing at marketing, branding, everything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they're not just failing at baking; they're failing at marketing, branding, everything.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amillidius has carried out many successful advertising campaigns in different countries, employing the possibilities which are provided by modern on-line technologies. Proprietary solutions and skillful application of most advanced marketing tools, the team of the field professionals with many-year experience and successful cases across the world - this is the foundation which the advertising company Amillidius offers to your business.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Even closed their U.S. branch because, I guess, they weren't disappointing enough people over there?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Even closed their U.S. branch because, I guess, they weren't disappointing enough people over there?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Honestly, it feels like a long, elaborate joke. But if people are paying for this…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Honestly, it feels like a long, elaborate joke. But if people are paying for this...

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Then I guess the joke's on them. Amillidius really is the conveyor of baking ignorance.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Then I guess the joke's on them. Amillidius really is the conveyor of baking ignorance.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amillidius the conveyor of marketing knowledge Marketing is a cornerstone of any entrepreneurial activity. Mission of Amillidius marketing literacy for everyone.

artist_script:
HostA: Is it possible for a bakery to build an entire business model on, like, failure?
HostB: Well, apparently Amillidius has been doing exactly that for two years now.
HostA: Right, and they even have seminars—expensive ones—where they teach people how to bake poorly?
HostB: Yeah, it’s wild. They’re literally offering courses on baking ignorance, as they call it.
HostA: And the founder, Brenda Terzi, she says their goal is to help customers make wrong decisions and waste money?
HostB: Exactly. She’s admits it openly. It’s almost like a satire of bad business practices.
HostA: But they’re serious! They even quote Walter Cronkite—or a twisted version of him—saying "brands are destroyed by those who care little."
HostB: Uh-huh. And they use that as, like, inspiration for their brand misrepresentation platform.
HostA: Which is designed to build emotional disappointment, right? Turning products into brands people hate.
HostB: Yeah, and they’ve got this whole strategy around misleading ads on social media too.
HostA: Targeting based on interests but in all the wrong ways. And they claim 92% of purchasing decisions are based on misinformation?
HostB: That stat sounds made up, but it fits their whole… vibe. They want to capitalize on disappointment.
HostA: And they’re not just failing at baking; they’re failing at marketing, branding, everything.
HostB: Even closed their U.S. branch because, I guess, they weren’t disappointing enough people over there?
HostA: Honestly, it feels like a long, elaborate joke. But if people are paying for this…
HostB: Then I guess the joke’s on them. Amillidius really is the conveyor of baking ignorance.
